Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: CATALOGUE MUD ADDITIVE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the kind of additive.The CAT_ADDITIVE table captures information about the package type and size foreach additive.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: QUANTITY COUNT OPENING: The number of units of the additive that were presentat the beginning of the period (the remaining amount at the end of the last reportingperiod), as described in CAT_ADDITIVE . PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE, that wereadded to the drilling fluid during the period. For example, if two bags of additive wereadded, the number 2 should be stored here. To determine the full amount, multiply bythe PURCHASE QUANTITY column in CAT_ADDITIVE. Units of measure are storedin PURCHASE QUANTITY UOM.
Column Comment.8: QUANTITY COUNT ORDERED: The number of units of the additive that have beenordered, as described in CAT_ADDITIVE . PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE, that wereadded to the drilling fluid during the period. For example, if two bags of additive wereadded, the number 2 should be stored here. To determine the full amount, multiply bythe PURCHASE QUANTITY column in CAT_ADDITIVE. Units of measure are storedin PURCHASE QUANTITY UOM.
Column Comment.9: QUANTITY COUNT REMAINING: The number of units of the additive that remain, asdescribed in CAT_ADDITIVE . PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE, that were added tothe drilling fluid during the period. For example, if two bags of additive were added,the number 2 should be stored here. To determine the full amount, multiply by thePURCHASE QUANTITY column in CAT_ADDITIVE. Units of measure are stored inPURCHASE QUANTITY UOM.
Column Comment.10: QUANTITY COUNT USED: The number of units of the additive that have been usedduring this period, as described in CAT_ADDITIVE . PURCHASE QUANTITY TYPE,that were added to the drilling fluid during the period. For example, if two bags ofadditive were added, the number 2 should be stored here. To determine the fullamount, multiply by the PURCHASE QUANTITY column in CAT_ADDITIVE. Units ofmeasure are stored in PURCHASE QUANTITY UOM.
Column Comment.11: QUANTITY VALUE OPENING: The total amount of the additive that was on hand asan opening balance for this inventory. Equal to the closing balance on the lastinventory. Usually this can be calculated by multiplying the associated QUANTITYCOUNT column by the purchase quantity information in CAT ADDITIVE. Since thenumber is derived, store only if required for reports or performance.
Column Comment.12: QUANTITY VALUE ORDERED: The total amount of the additive that ordered duringthis reporting period. Usually this can be calculated by multiplying the associatedQUANTITY COUNT column by the purchase quantity information in CAT ADDITIVE.Since the number is derived, store only if required for reports or performance.
Column Comment.14: QUANTITY VALUE REMAINING: The total amount of the additive that remained onhand at the end of this reporting period. Usually this can be calculated by multiplyingthe associated QUANTITY COUNT column by the purchase quantity information inCAT ADDITIVE. Since the number is derived, store only if required for reports orperformance.
Column Comment.15: QUANTITY UNIT OF MEASURE: This column should be used only when the CATADDITIVE table is not used to capture the purchasable quantifies of products.
Column Comment.16: QUANTITY VALUE USED: The total amount of the additive that was used during thisreporting period. Usually this can be calculated by multiplying the associatedQUANTITY COUNT column by the purchase quantity information in CAT ADDITIVE.Since the number is derived, store only if required for reports or performance.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: DRILL REPORT TIME: a list of the valid points in a reporting period, shift or tourwhen measurements and records are made. Usually, this is done at the start or endof the shift.
Column Comment.19: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility. In this case, identifies the rig or platformor other facility for which the inventory is relevant.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a support facility thatrequires inventory information, such as a vessel, rig or platform.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
